text: When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

You're immortal, but you're also a monster.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. The people who took the drug are immortal, but also a monsters. 

The drug wreaked havoc on their ability to feel positive things, or care for other people.  You had lived your life resenting the researchers, but now you feel guilty.

Nobody else care about them enough, and they don't care about anyone else. Your siblings are cold and uncaring immortals, going through life with no meaning. They are sociopathic monsters, not caring who they hurt, and have lost all connection with other humans. 


After trying to help them, and getting nowhere, you come to the conclusion that there is nothing that can be done for them. 
You may be the "Lost Generation", but it is they who are truly lost .  You erect a tomb for them, at the family plot.
